sections.chief_complaint: 59-year-old female presents for pre-operative assessment prior to scheduled CABG.
sections.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports chest pain with exertion, relieved by rest. Three-vessel coronary artery disease on recent catheterization. Ejection fraction 45%.
sections.cardiac_history: History of inferior MI in 2020. Prior PCI to RCA with drug-eluting stent. Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation on anticoagulation.
sections.physical_exam: BP 145/88, HR 72, SpO2 97% on room air. Irregular rhythm. No murmurs. Bilateral lower extremity edema 1+.
sections.assessment_plan: High-risk patient for CABG. Recommend holding Clopidogrel 5 days pre-op, bridging anticoagulation. Cardiology consulted for afib management. Consider IABP standby.

source_transcript: Good afternoon Mrs. Garcia. I'm Dr. Raubenheimer, the anesthesiologist. You're here for your pre-op before your bypass surgery. How are you feeling? [Patient: Nervous but ready to get it done.] I understand. Any chest pain recently? [Patient: Yes, when I walk too far or climb stairs. Goes away when I rest.] Good that it goes away with rest. Now, your heart cath showed three-vessel disease, and your heart function is about 45%, which is a bit reduced. Let me go through your medications. Metoprolol? [Patient: Yes, 25 twice a day.] Lisinopril? [Patient: 5 milligrams in the morning.] Aspirin? [Patient: 325, one a day.] Plavix? [Patient: Yes, 75.] Any blood thinners like warfarin or Eliquis? [Patient: No, just the aspirin and Plavix.] Any allergies? [Patient: Penicillin gives me a rash.] Any other allergies? [Patient: No, just that one.] Okay. I see you had a heart attack back in 2020 and had a stent placed. Any irregular heartbeats? [Patient: Sometimes my heart races but it hasn't happened in a while.] We'll watch for that. Your blood pressure today is 145/88, heart rate 72. Rhythm sounds a bit irregular. No swelling in your legs. We'll need to stop the Plavix five days before surgery.
